tvs.caption: Pre-hook(s)
tvs.name: fb_prehooks
tvs.description: A snippet name (or comma separated list of names). They are run before the form is initialised. Useful for prefilling form fields with existing data.

tvs.caption: Render hook(s)
tvs.name: fb_renderhooks
tvs.description: A snippet name (or comma separated list of names) to execute. They are run when the form loads and all pre-hooks are finished. Useful for fetching session data.

tvs.caption: Hook(s)
tvs.name: fb_hooks
tvs.description: A snippet name (or comma separated list of names) to execute. They are run after the form is submitted, but before any emails are sent (or user is created). Useful for additional validation.

tvs.caption: Post-hook(s)
tvs.name: fb_posthooks
tvs.description: A snippet name (or comma separated list of names) to execute. They are run after the form is fully submitted and all emails are sent. Useful for writing submitted values to the database.

tvs.caption: Email template row prefix
tvs.name: fb_email_tpl_prefix
tvs.description: Prefix used by the chunks containing the HTML for the template rows. After this prefix follows an ID (i.e. fbEmailRow_28), connecting that chunk to the correct ContentBlocks field.

tvs.caption: Dynamic recipient address
tvs.name: fb_email_to_dynamic
tvs.description: Place any snippet / FastField call here that outputs a single email address. WARNING: populating this field will override the default recipient address, so test thoroughly!

tvs.caption: Dynamic redirect page
tvs.name: fb_redirect_dynamic
tvs.description: Place any element here that is able to decide where to redirect the user after form submission. If the result is empty, it falls back on the ID provided under general settings.

tvs.caption: Store submitted data temporarily
tvs.name: fb_store_data
tvs.description: Store data in session before redirecting the user to a confirmation / thank you page, or to another form (as part of a multi-page form). Use FormItRetriever to access the data again.

tvs.caption: Temporary storage timeout
tvs.name: fb_store_time
tvs.description: If 'store data' is switched on, this specifies the number of seconds to store the submitted form data. Defaults to five minutes.

tvs.caption: Attachment path
tvs.name: fb_attachment_path
tvs.description: Stored uploads are saved in this folder. The path needs to be relative to the location of the assets_path setting. Please note that [[*id]] will be parsed, but other placeholders wont.
